file_content.text: I have a sector to run--I can't deal with you now.
I heard there was action in Grathan's place. Not many people make it in and out like that.
But I'm not seeing my men. Tell me what you found in there.
Grathan was experimenting on them--converting them into machines.
They were test subjects.
Machines. Right.
You don't want to hear.
It was really that bad?
Don't worry about it. They're corpses now.
Dead meat.
All of them? Damn.
I'd heard rumors about Grathan's repulsive methods, and I have a strong stomach, but....
I feel a little sick right now. I was hoping they'd be okay. What an idiot I am.
They didn't suffer--I made sure of that. It was the least I could do.
I put them down.
Is that right? I... well, I actually appreciate that. Guess it had to be done.
Give it time. You'll be alright.
It'll be okay.
Didn't say I wouldn't be.
Weakness doesn't suit a servant of the Empire.
You're pathetic.
Of course. You're right, my lord. I apologize.
Channel your feelings into rage, and make rage your weapon.
Use your anger.
Good Sith advice. I'll do my best.
People die in our line of work. Your people knew that when they joined the military.
Their job involved risk.
Sorry--I'm not used to bringing targets back alive.
Too bad you're disappointed.
You're sort of heartless, aren't you? It's alright, though.
You got the information I wanted, so you earned your pay. Take it. Those kids won't miss a few credits.
Now I've got to send word to their families and return their belongings. Then it'll be time to recruit some fresh faces....
All part of the job, Captain. I'm sure you'll get it done.
It's your duty.
Lovely thought. I'll see you around.
Good luck.
Thanks. I'll need it.
Maybe your next recruits will be more capable. If not, I'm sure Lord Grathan will appreciate the fresh supply.
More cannon fodder.
Don't you--nevermind. Forget it.
So. I guess I have you to thank for returning my soldiers.
My soldiers, who've been tormented and put in droid bodies. My soldiers, whom I didn't even recognize at first. You brought them back to me.
I did exactly what you asked me to do. I returned them alive.
As you requested.
You sound displeased.
They'll serve the Empire better than ever now.
They're stronger and improved.
They'll certainly be loyal, and they've sure got firepower. But that's secondary.
They're missing their minds. They'll take orders, but they can't... think like people anymore.
Not your fault. I get that. Blast. But looking at those droids makes me sick.
The military has scientists, resources--someone should be able to aid them.
Can't they be helped?
The Science Bureau wants them for research. Moff Ghorrin wants them for a special strike team. Whatever's left of their lives won't be pretty.
I couldn't leave them under Grathan's control.
I had to free them.
No. I suppose not.
You're pathetic.
Best thing to hope for is that, with time, they don't remember what's happened. Hope that their brains shut down completely. Blast it all.
Anyway, you earned your pay. You made my superiors very happy. But those men....
My job is done.
You did the job, yes.
They're lucky to be alive, after all they've been through.
At least they survived.
Your attitude serves you poorly.
Learn to deal with it.
Understood. You won't hear it again.
If you're angry, focus that anger against our enemies.
Use your rage.
Oh, I've got enough anger for everyone right now.
I suggest you keep your doubts to yourself.
Follow your orders.
You're right. I know my place.
I've seen people hurt worse.
It's not so bad.
One way of looking at it, I guess.
I'll see you around. And anyway, I need to contact these droids' families....
You found any sign of my men yet?
Hold your position, please, and keep your weapons holstered. The remotes are scanning you now.
Identification = complete. Uploading.
You check out. Sorry, my lord--we're on the lookout for anyone with Lord Grathan, and I'm sick of letting him stomp on my people.
You check out. Sorry if I was brusque. We're on the lookout for anyone with Lord Grathan, and I'm sick of letting him stomp on my people.
My lightsaber is the only authorization I need to pass.
You dare question me?
You should not question a Sith so boldly.
Arrogant woman.
With respect, being Sith doesn't get you a pass here. Not when it's one of your own who's the problem.
I'm on Imperial Intelligence business. I don't appreciate being delayed.
You shouldn't question me.
We've all got our orders.
Most people who tell me to keep my weapons holstered don't last long.
Be glad I didn't shoot first.
Neither do bounty hunters who shoot Imperial captains.
Oh?
Who is Lord Grathan?
Grathan?
Look--stick around a minute. I don't know if you're familiar with the situation, but Grathan's a nightmare. The Sith Lord's gone rogue.
He's holed up in his estate past the Wall. He's got weapons, shields and a cadre of scientists developing new tech to use against us.
What's Grathan after? It sounds like he's taking an awful risk.
Why?
Why not just bomb his estate from orbit?
So take him out.
Officially? Grathan's strong defenses make it too costly. Unofficially... it's political. Some Sith think Grathan's worth keeping around.
It takes strength to defy the Empire.
Impressive.
It takes an idiot. Grathan can't keep this up forever. Eventually, someone will move against him.
Grathan wants respect and authority from the Dark Council. So in true Sith fashion, he's turned on his masters to prove his power.
As a result, we have to put up with his lunacy. So if you're here to cause Grathan problems anyway, you might help us out.
I live to serve the Empire.
Indeed.
If it suits my plans, perhaps I will.
Maybe.
Glad to help my comrades in the military.
Of course.
Are you saying you're hiring?
Is this a job?
Depends. Are you any good?
You have weapons and training--handle things yourself.
Aren't you capable?
Believe me, I'd like to, but my hands are tied.
I can't today.
That's fine. If you've got business in Grathan's house, then you can take care of everything at once.
Here's the story: There are nearly a hundred men assigned to this sector--some on the Wall, some watching Grathan. Twenty are missing.
My men--practically my kids. Grathan stole them, and I want them back.
Why would Lord Grathan be kidnapping soldiers?
What's he up to?
And my part?
If your men can't protect themselves, why should I help?
They already proved weak.
Blast it. We're talking about Imperial soldiers!
I don't know what Lord Grathan wants with them. Maybe he's holding them hostage just to demoralize us. Who knows?
But if you're heading to Grathan's grounds, help them get out. Tell them to report back to their Duchess. That's, ah--that's what they call me.
Very well.
"Duchess"? You'll have to explain that.
They call you what?
You try making it as an officer without getting tagged with a nickname.
They're your soldiers, "Duchess." That makes them your problem.
This isn't my concern.
What an attitude, no surprise there. Look, help get those people back, and I can pay you for your time.
Payment, eh?
Glad you can change your mind.
We'll see.
Good enough.
I've got reports saying that Grathan's been transporting prisoners to another wing of his estate. I don't know if it's my people he's moving, but it's worth checking out.
Watch yourself. Grathan doesn't mess around.
Not today. [Refuse quest]
Glad to see you're a patriot. Get out of here.
I don't think we have any business. Move along.
